result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy L. Love Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tommy L. Love Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tommy L. Love Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing on Revocation - 11/21/2017

10:10 a.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Tommy L. Love in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Pfeifer/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence

Initial Confiement - 1 year 6 months

Jail credit - 145 days

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. WEDS given.

records.addlTxt:
2:44 p.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer states agreement/Richards concurs. State moves to amend Count 2 to Possession of Cocaine - 2nd offense a violation of 961.41(3g)(c), a Class I Felony- Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 3 - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jai credit - 10 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal Rights given. NADVI given. 
Cash bond posted to be applied towards court costs and any balance to be refunded to poster.
Adj. 3:00 p.m.

3:22 p.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards statement - matter is not resolved - requests jury trial date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:27 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

4:07 p.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards - has spoken with defendant - ride took detour and defendant was asleep - still 1 1/2 hours away - requests adjournment. Pfeifer has no objections. Bail continued. Adj. 4:09 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:27 p.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has been in custody. Civil forfeiture tracking with this matter. Schiek statement to bond. Defendant states reason for Milwaukee custody - warrant was issued, charges were filed, jury trial and was acquited at jury trial. Defendant states he informed Oneida County one week prior to court date while incarcerated in Milwaukee County. Court states Milwaukee County case 16cf4736 - defendant was found not guilty at trial. Schiek further statement to bond. Court quashes warrant and reinstates previous cash bond. Adj. 1:34 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Extradition papers - will extridite
per Brandi @ ONSO - on detainer in Milwaukee Cty

3:50 p.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards states it appears that defendant is in custody in Milwaukee County per VINE website. State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:52 p.m.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards statement - State still in process of gathering evidence - not in position to resolve case - Michlig statement - agrees with Richards as to evidence - has had meaningful negotiations in meantime towards resolution - requests adjourned pre-trial - Bail continued. Adj. 2:07 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

3:38 p.m. Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards in receipt of Information-waives further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued. Adj. 3:39 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Case called 2:55 p.m.:  Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Officer K.P. sworn/direct.  Record reflects identification of defendant/cross.  Atty Richards statement to court.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
and Inspection

03:01 pm - Defendant Tommy L. Love in court with attorney Mary Hogan appearing on behalf of Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Search Warrant Return

02:59 pm - Defendant Tommy L. Love in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant requests additional time to come up with money for retainer.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy L. Love in court, via video  in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Michlig to bail - Defendant statement - Court sets $ cash bond -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
